abstract: Disc 1: The Great Ship (wri/dir. Christopher Spencer, 50 min.)--The Brooklyn Bridge (wri/dir. Paul Wilmshurst, 50 min.)--Bell Rock Lighthouse (prod/dir. Christopher Spencer, 50 min.). Disc 2: The Sewer King (prod/dir. Edward Bazalgette, 50 min.)--The Panama Canal (prod/dir. Philip Smith, 50 min.)--The Line (wri/dir. Paul Bryers, 50 min.)--The Hoover Dam (wri/dir. Mark Everest, 50 min.).
description: This seven part television series is about seven wonders of civil engineering in the industrial age and 'modern' world. Man-made and magnificent, the series covers the creation of the biggest steam ship ever built, the Brooklyn Bridge, the Bell Rock Lighthouse, London's sewerage system, the Panama Canal, the trans-American Railway and the Hoover Dam. Using actors in period costume and settings, and aided by computer animation techniques, this docu-drama style telling re-enacts the language and manners of the day to impart information in a really appealing way. The trials and controversies that occur when such huge constructions are undertaken - including the loss of life - are also covered. Narrated by Robert Lindsay.
